item.title: Use the “executive summary” Style Writing That Respects Your reader’s Time
item.description: Use the “executive summary” Style Writing That Respects Your reader’s Time Put your key points up front. Use bullet points or numbered lists.

item.title: Febreeze Habit
item.description: Febreeze Habit [[Febreeze]] originally didn’t sell well because consumers found the lack of smell strange. It was only after they added a smell that it became a hit.

item.title: The Rise And Fall Of Blitzscaling!
item.description: The Rise And Fall Of Blitzscaling! When to Blitzscale [[Blitzscaling]] makes sense if your app relies on network effects. Amazon is the king of [[Blitzscaling]] MoviePass is the opposite of that

item.title: Toothbrush Removing Film Over Teeth
item.description: Toothbrush Removing Film Over Teeth Businesses told consumers to focus on the film over their teeth and how brushing your teeth removes it, leaving a nice sensation.

item.title: What It Takes
item.description: What It Takes [[People Don’t See Turning Points, Where Things Could Have Gone Either Way]] At Yale Never Took Economics, [[Permanent Notes/You Don’t Need to Be Economics Major for Business]] Sprinter in college, [[Student Athlete]] From failing essays to Dean’s List Dick’s letter encouraged him to stay in school, best thing he did.
